intro: Echeandia montealbanensis, commonly known as the Monte Albán echeandia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
